They felt so embarrassed  (especially when other customers asked me quite loudly if they had forgotten my order) when they realized I was the person who called earlier that they told me to get free desserts... now do I really want desserts if I didn't order them??? I shook my head no (since not even their hired help speaks English) and left-luckily my car was still there without any tickets).  Get your Sh&% together people!
author: Anne L.

description: i can't stop eating here! i try and go somewhere els but end up in line deciding on one of the three things! how could you go wrong as long as you get some of the plump warm chicken buns! the employees and service are outstanding as well!
author: David F.

description: Liars.  The menu states "organic and sustainable ingredients are used whenever possible."  Why then, pray tell, is their produce delivery a parade of wholesale, conventionally-grown items?  Even Niman Ranch--while tasty and highly recommendable--is not organic.  Either restate "we might consider using an organic ingredient or two now and then" or remove this false statement from the menu altogether.  Shame on you, Out The Door.
author: Kyle F.

description: the most bland dish i've ever received from a vietnamese palce.  lemongrass tofu and veggies sans any real lemongrass.  and i am tired of this surcharge for brown rice business.  boo.
author: e w.

description: Bad news.  Have been going to Out The Door and Slanted Door for 10+ years and have always loved the food.  Last Saturday we had breakfast at Out The Door at the Ferry Building and got the Hanoi beef pho and the duck porridge.  The porridge was burnt!  I am an Asian cook and the taste of burnt rice is very distinctive and a pot of burnt porridge should never have been served.  Serving burnt porridge means that the cook did not taste the porridge or worse, they tasted it and served it anyways, thinking that these tourists (we are locals) won't notice.  The pho broth was tasteless and for $9, there was exactly 3 pieces of overcooked beef and 3 limp branches of basil and couple of slices of peppers to go with it.  Again, pretty lame.  We were just in Hanoi last month.  Hanoi pho usually do not come with veggies on the side like Saigon pho so the tiny plate of limp veggies did not go with the dish in the first place.  The plate of hot pepper sauce with soy sauce was also not the kind of condiments you get with Hanoi beef pho.  All in all, very disappointing, especially when the price was so high.  $9 pho should at least be good and $8 porridge should at least be not burnt, especially for take out!  Previously, the food was so good we did not mind paying for the premium prices but this really is not expectable.  Sorry to see a good restaurant slide.  I hope this is just a blip but a place with a reputation like Slanted Door or Out The Door should not have a "bad day".  We will most likely not go back again.  Too bad.
author: Hanuman C.

description: Beats Slanted Door food any day & reasonably priced. Chicken congee is excellent as well as everything else there. Well worth the trek to get there & the cost of parking.
author: S M.

description: Service was quick, especially for a Saturday during market time.  I only waited about one minute for my item.  Lemongrass pork vermicelli was really good.  I'll have to try it again to see how other items hold up. . .
author: Kristin L.

description: Out the door was pretty good.  With limited time on our hands, the waiter took our orders and then promptly delivered drinks, starters, and our shared entree.  I was pleasantly surprised by the prompt and courteous service.  The spring rolls were amazing.  We shared the 5 spiced chicken which is one of their signature dishes....it was good but not sure what all the fuss is about on this one.  Overall, good place to catch a meal while shopping or grabbing a decent meal before the movies at the Century shopping center.
author: K J.

description: In the Ferry Building, where else can you get lunch for $2?  No, I mean if you need more than a square of fleur de sel caramel? Chicken buns, the pre-paycheck chick fil a.
author: Nicole H.

description: My friend and I just went here on our lunch hour and were extremely disappointed.  I ordered the vermicelli with shrimp a.k.a. a tiny bowl of tasteless white soggy noodles with lettuce and uncooked shrimp. Extremely disappointing.  My friend ordered the pork sandwich, a.k.a. a bunch of carrot strips in bread with fatty meat.  We've been to slanted door and loved it so we were really upset with our experience!  Two thumbs down!
author: Holly S.

description: Every meal I have at this place has been terrific. The fresh rolls and sandwiches are my favs.
author: Ian W.

description: the kindest description would be "underwhelming".  The most truthful would be "terrible service, miserly portions, obscene prices, only mediocre quality compared to other Vietnamese places that charge half as much, did I mention terrible service?"  Our waitron had such a thick euro accent he was nearly impossible to understand.  Our appetizers didn't begin to appear until half our party were well into our entrees, and even then, half of our appetizers showed up as some in our party were finishing their entrees, making for a very clumsy lunch for our party of 8.  Unlike most cheaper Viet plaes, we had to beg for simple condiments, so by the time they arrived the food was cold.  Absolutely, positively, unquestionably will NEVER go back.  Would give negative stars if that were possible.  Since gratuity was included, we couldn't even show our disgust by leaving a small tip.  Best Advice:  Go to TuLan instead, pay 2/3 less and get better food, larger portions, better service in the same neighborhood.
author: karu s.
